org.sd.cluster.data
Class DataDescriptor

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.cluster.data.DataDescriptor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Clusterable, Publishable
Direct Known Subclasses:
OutputDataDescriptor
public class DataDescriptor
extends java.lang.Object
implements Publishable, Clusterable

An class to encapsulate the definition of a data store.

Author:
Spence Koehler

setClusterContext

public void setClusterContext(ClusterContext clusterContext)
Set this clusterable's clusterContext.

Note that this is not set until a cluster node's node server handles a message that uses this clusterable object and the message passes the context along to this clusterable object.

Specified by:
setClusterContext in interface Clusterable
Parameters:
clusterContext - this object's clusterContext.

getClusterContext

public ClusterContext getClusterContext()
Get this clusterable's clusterContext.

Specified by:
getClusterContext in interface Clusterable
Returns:
this object's clusterContext.

getDataId

public java.lang.String getDataId()
Get the dataId or name for the data.

getNodes

public java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getNodes()
Get the nodes (machine-jvmNum) over which the data is partitioned or full data is replicated.

Note that these nodes are where the final data ends up to be used for input, not necessarily the same as the nodes where it is created.

Returns:
nodes or null if data is accessed via a common mount point.

getNumPartitions

public int getNumPartitions()
Get the number of partitions for the data.

Note that these partitions are where the final data ends up to be used for input, not necessarily the same as the partitions where it is created.

           throws java.io.IOException

read

public void read(java.io.DataInput dataInput)
          throws java.io.IOException
Read this message's contents from the dataInput stream that was written by this.write(dataOutput).

NOTE: this requires all implementing classes to have a default constructor with no args.

Specified by:
